parts

Class LeftPart

  • java.lang.Object
    • parts.LeftPart

  • public class LeftPart
extends java.lang.Object
    LeftPart

    Builds an MPart and it's associated UI. Since this Part contains a table, there is an additional method fillTable() for filling it with SampleObjects.

    Uses IEventBroker to send the SampleObject to the other parts. Doing so requires adding a few things to the MANIFEST.MF:

    1. org.eclipse.osgi.services
    2. org.eclipse.e4.core.services
    3. org.eclipse.e4.core.di.extensions

    These can be added by:

    1. Navigating to your project hierarchy, opening the 'META-INF' folder and opening the 'MANIFEST.MF'.
    2. In the opened MANIFEST.MF, choose the 'Dependencies' tab at the bottom.
    3. In the Dependencies tab, navigate to the 'Required Plug-ins' section and click 'Add'.

    When posting via the IEventBroker, use the following format for your 'topic' String:

    • "topic/name"
    • In the most basic form, any String you wish can be substituted for either 'topic' or 'name' but a String on either side AND the '/' are REQUIRED.**
    • NOTE: The String built here will be used in the receiver to identify what to listen for.
    • **Of course there are always exceptions to rules, so if you'd like to learn more follow the links provided at the bottom of this Javadoc.

    Author:
    William Lake
    See Also:
    Eclipse IEventBroker API, Eclipse4/RCP/Event Model, Vogella tutorial: 'Eclipse 4 event system (EventAdmin) - Tutorial'

      • postConstruct

public void postConstruct(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent)
        Builds the UI for the LeftPart.
        Parameters:
        parent - The part Composite to build the UI on.

      • fillTable

        private void fillTable()
        Fills the table object with SampleObjects. Builds the TableColumns first, then creates the SampleObjects, and finally pack()s everything up. The NUMOBJECTS constant dictates how many SampleObjects to build.
